This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=GERMANPHILOSOPHY.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-03-10T08:04:40Z Johan Siebers 2015-03-10T08:04:33+00:00 2015-03-10T08:04:33+00:00 Next session https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GERMANPHILOSOPHY;27bef8da.1503 Dear List Members, on 16 March we will have the next session of our seminar. We will discuss the use Zizek and Badiou make of the concept of the vanishing mediator, and how their ideas might help us in our attempt to understand the movement of exile in Empedocles and Lao Tzu. [...] Johan Siebers 2015-03-03T06:37:43+00:00 2015-03-03T06:37:43+00:00 Fw: Straub-Huillet Screenings, Goethe-Institut, 10 + 12 March 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GERMANPHILOSOPHY;52d5526b.1503 Dear list members,<br><br>the program for the upcoming Straub-Huillet screenings at the Goethe Institut.<br><br>Best<br>Johan<br><br>Sent using OWA for iPhone Shihan Desilva 2015-03-02T09:41:52+00:00 2015-03-02T09:41:52+00:00 Seminar at 4 pm today https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GERMANPHILOSOPHY;7750ba7.1503 Dear Johan Thanks for the paper. I will be coming to the seminar today. Best wishes Dr Hemal Jayasuriya (message sent on behalf of) Johan Siebers 2015-02-25T08:39:26+00:00 2015-02-25T08:39:26+00:00 German philosophy seminar - next session https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GERMANPHILOSOPHY;76665615.1502 Dear members,<br><br>A reminder of the next session of the German philosophy seminar, next Monday 2 March. We will be discussing the concept of the vanishing mediator in the work of Frederic Jameson.<br><br>Pre-reading: Jameson's 1973 article "The Vanishing Mediator: Narrative Structure in Max Weber" (New German Critique 1, pp. 52-89). In this article Jameson introduced the concept. I attach a copy of the article; you can also access it via the seminar blog. [...] Johan Siebers 2015-02-18T14:26:46+00:00 2015-02-18T14:26:46+00:00 Next session - Monday 23 February https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GERMANPHILOSOPHY;b7c316c1.1502 Dear list members,<br><br>A reminder of our next seminar session, Monday 23 February, when we will discuss Straub and Huillet's Der Tod des Empedokles in relation to the three versions of H\ufffd\ufffdlderlin's play.<br><br>best<br><br>Johan<br><br>Dr Johan Siebers<br>Institute of Modern Languages Research<br>School of Advanced Study<br>University of London<br>Senate House<br>Malet Street<br>WC1E 7HU<br>London<br><br>+44 20 7862 8738<br>+44 7894 741174<br>http://modernlanguages.sas.ac.uk<br>http://www.sas.academia.edu/JohanSiebers [...] Johan Siebers 2015-02-04T07:26:16+00:00 2015-02-04T07:26:16+00:00 German Philosophy Seminar 9 February https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GERMANPHILOSOPHY;282211a3.1502 Dear list members,<br><br>A reminder of our next German Philosophy Seminar, on 9 February. We will watch (most of) Huillet and Straub's Der Tod des Empedokles and discuss it. The text used for the film is the 1798 version (the "first version"). It may be advisable to read the text in advance, and/or bring your copy. The text can be found on our blog, on the resources page, in German and in an English translation (pp. 38-107 of the Krell translation). [...] Johan Siebers 2015-01-18T19:19:57+00:00 2015-01-18T19:19:57+00:00 Next Session German Philosophy Seminar - 9 February https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GERMANPHILOSOPHY;3076a972.1501 Dear list members,<br><br>The next session of the German Philosophy Seminar will take place on Monday 9 February.<br><br>We will watch and discuss Straub and Huillet's 1986 film Der Tod des Empedokles, based on the first version of H\ufffd\ufffdlderlin's play, from 1798. Straub and Huillet's bare cinematographic aesthetics may at first seem at odds with the classical language of the first version of H\ufffd\ufffdldelin's play, but on a closer look the two forms share a severity and deliberate alienation that sets the language of the play, and the imagination of the viewer, free. Straub and Huillet intentionally used amateur actors [...] Johan Siebers 2015-01-12T09:25:36+00:00 2015-01-12T09:25:36+00:00 Fw: German Philosophy Seminar, 12 January, Dialectics in Development, Guest Speaker Harm Boukema https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GERMANPHILOSOPHY;6fede863.1501 Dear all,<br><br>A reminder of today's seminar.<br><br>best<br><br>Johan<br><br>___<br><br>On Monday 12 January the German Philosophy Seminar will reconvene for the second semester of this academic year (On the West-Eastern Couch: Empedocles and Lao-Tzu as Vanishing Mediators).<br><br>I am pleased to let you know that we will start the semester with a guest speaker:<br><br>Monday 12 January, 16:00-18:00<br>Senate House, room 243 [...] Johan Siebers 2015-01-05T11:30:36+00:00 2015-01-05T11:30:36+00:00 German Philosophy Seminar, 12 January, Dialectics in Development, Guest Speaker Harm Boukema https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GERMANPHILOSOPHY;80fe47d3.1501 Dear participants,<br><br>Happy New Year! On Monday 12 January the German Philosophy Seminar will reconvene for the second semester of this academic year (On the West-Eastern Couch: Empedocles and Lao-Tzu as Vanishing Mediators).<br><br>I am pleased to let you know that we will start the semester with a guest speaker:<br><br>Monday 12 January, 16:00-18:00<br>Senate House, room 243 [...] Johan Siebers 2014-12-01T07:12:01+00:00 2014-12-01T07:12:01+00:00 URGENT Today's Seminar - cancellation due to illness. https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GERMANPHILOSOPHY;c4187c44.1412 Dear participants,<br><br>Unfortunately I have to cancel today's session last minute due to illness. I have the flu and had hoped I would be able to run the session anyway, but my present condition does not allow it.<br><br>I am very sorry about this; we will postpone our reading of Der Tod des Empedokles until after Christmas. Jeremy Coleman will give an introduction to Henze`s setting of the poem.
